etymology.interpretation: 古 provides the approximate sound, while the flesh component ⺼ points to a bodily sense, aligning with meanings like “beard.” Over time, usage broadened to include an ethnonym and a common surname.

examples.chinese: 他留着长胡子(他留著長鬍子)。
古代汉人称北方民族为胡人(古代漢人稱北方民族為胡人)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài Hànrén chēng Běifāng mínzú wéi Húrén.
examples.english: In ancient times, Han people referred to northern peoples as Hu.
